titlepage.titleproper: Register of the Latin American Subject Collection, 1932-2000
titlepage.publisher:
Hoover Institution Archives
Stanford University
Stanford, California

defitem.label: Processed by:
defitem.item: Rebecca J. Mead and David Jacobs

titlepage.p: © 1998 Hoover Institution Archives. All rights reserved.

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Latin American Subject Collection,

physdesc.label: Extent
physdesc.extent: 5 manuscript boxes, 1 oversize box, 1 cubic foot box, 1 videotape cassette, 12 phonorecords.

did.abstract: Reports, correspondence, position papers, bulletins, serial issues, newsletters, campaign material, speeches, minutes, resolutions, printed matter, and audiovisual materials, relating to political conditions in various Latin American countries, especially to guerrilla activities, election campaigns and civil rights; and to United States foreign policy in Latin America.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Latin American Subject Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog Socrates at http://library.stanford.edu/webcat. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in Socrates is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1914-1994

scopecontent.p: Reports, correspondence, position papers, bulletins, serial issues, newsletters, flyers, campaign material, circulars, speeches, clippings, minutes, resolutions, charts, photographs, and miscellany. Arranged alphabetically by subject

did.unittitle: OVERSIZE FILE, 1936-1991

scopecontent.p: Election material, serial issues, flyers, religious instructional material, prints, political poems, fables and stories by Roque Dalton, Jorge Luis Oviedo, and Roberto Sosa

did.unittitle: AUDIOVISUAL FILE, ca. 1963-1987

scopecontent.p: 12 phonorecords of songs and speeches from various Latin American and Central American countries, ca. 1963-1981, and 1 videotape cassette entitled Minefield,relating to Uruguay, Chile and Argentina, 1987

did.unittitle: SUBJECT FILE, 1914-1994
General
General
Newsletter, bulletin, speeches, pamphlets, serial issue, printed article, reports, and a flyer, 1969-1989. Primarily material published in the United States

Reports, pamphlets, speeches and other printed matter in English, 1966-1993, concerning political and economic conditions in Latin America and United States foreign policy in Latin America. Includes material on United States military interventions in Latin America, business investments, narcotics traffic and Latin American immigration to the United States

Carter Center. Pamphlets, statements by Jimmy Carter, press releases, clippings, reports, and newsletters, 1988-1990. Primarily relates to electoral observations in Haiti, Guyana, Nicaragua, and the Dominican Republic

Sanchez, Nestor D.. Interview with and speeches by Nestor D. Sanchez, Deputy Assistant Secretary of Defense for Inter-American Affairs, 1981-1986, concerning security issues involving the United States and Latin America

Central America. Newsletters, position papers, speech, leaflets, clippings, pamphlets, serial issue, and reports, 1983-1993. Includes material relating to human rights, regional leftist organizations, and peace plans
Dominican Republic. Speech, pamphlets, program statement, serial issues, report and miscellany, 1965-1994. Includes material published by the Partido Comunista Dominicano
Ecuador. Report, printed excerpt, and program statement by the Partido Comunista del Ecuador, 1974-1987, and two pamphlets of the Instituto Ecuatoriano de Economia Politica, 1993
Grenada. Reports, speech transcript, and newsletters, 1983-1989. Includes material relating to the death of Maurice Bishop. SEE ALSO: OVERSIZE FILE
Guyana. Pamphlet issued by the People's Progressive Party, 1971
Haiti. Pamphlets, and reports on 1990 elections, 1980-1992
Jamaica. Report on 1989 election, 1989
Martinique. Serial issue (Parti Communiste Martiniquais), 1963
Paraguay. News bulletins, report on 1989 election, and pamphets, 1932-1989. Includes material relating to the Chaco War with Bolivia
Puerto Rico. Leaflet, pamphlet, and report, 1979-1988
OVERSIZE FILE, 1936-1991.
Election material, serial issues, flyers, religious instructional material, prints, political poems, printed fables and stories by Roque Dalton, Jorge Luis Oviedo, and Roberto Sosa.
AUDIOVISUAL FILE, ca. 1963-1987
Phonorecords of songs and speeches from various Latin American and Central American countries, ca. 1963-1981
"Alliance for Progress." Six records of speeches by Milton S. Eisenhower, Raul Prebisch, Jose Figueres, Teodoro Moscoso and Dean Rusk about the Alliance for Progress
"Cancion Protesta: Protest Song of Latin America." One record of songs by various artists, 1970
"Dominican Republic: La Hora Esta LLegando! The Time Is Coming!" One record of songs by Expresion Joven, 1974
"Ecuador: The Cry of Freedom! El Grito de Libertad!" One record of songs by Jatari, 1976
"Como El Filo del Machete, Like the Edge of the Machete." One record of Puerto Rican songs by Andre Jimenez, 1978
"Tengo Puerto Rico en Mi Corazon, I Have Puerto Rico in My Heart." One record of songs by Pepe y Flora, 1971
"Viva Puerto Rico Libre." One record of songs by various artists, 1978
1 videotape cassette entitled Minefield, relating to Uruguay, Chile, and Argentina, 1987
